* The main JavaFX application class for DaBot.
* Initializes the task storage, loads tasks from file, and starts the GUI.
* Provides the {@code handle} method to process user input and return responses.
* @param stage The primary stage for this application.
public void start(Stage stage) throws Exception {
* Handles a single line of user input and returns DaBot’s reply.
return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";

return "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + tasks.get(idx1 - 1);
return "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + removed + "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";

* Controller class for the main GUI window of DaBot.
* Handles initialization, displaying messages, and user input events.

* Handles saving and loading of {@link Task} objects to and from the disk.
* The {@code Storage} class abstracts away file I/O details, ensuring that
* tasks can be persisted across program runs. Tasks are stored one per line
* in a plain text file and encoded/decoded using {@link Task#encodeString()}
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object to manage a given file path.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks will be saved/loaded
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* Each line of the file is decoded into a {@link Task}. Invalid lines
* are skipped with a warning. If the file does not exist, an empty list
* @return a list of tasks loaded from file; empty if file is missing
* @throws DabotException if the file cannot be read due to I/O issues
throw new DabotException("Failed to load tasks: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves a list of tasks into the storage file.
* Each task is written on a new line using its encoded string form.
* Creates the file and parent directories if they do not exist.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save
* @throws DabotException if the tasks cannot be saved due to I/O issues
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws DabotException {
throw new DabotException("Failed to save tasks: " + e.getMessage());
* Handles all user interactions with the chatbot.
* The {@code Ui} class is responsible for reading user input,
* displaying messages, and printing feedback about tasks
* and operations performed by the chatbot.
* Constructs a {@code Ui} object with a {@link Scanner} to read user input.
* Reads a non-empty line of input from the user.
* Keeps prompting until a non-blank line is entered.

* Displays the welcome message when the chatbot starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays the goodbye message when the chatbot exits.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints an error message to the user.
* @param message the error message to display
* Shows a confirmation message when a task is added.
* @param task  the task that was added
* @param count the new total number of tasks
public void showAdd(Task task, int count) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n\t" + task + "\n");
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
* Shows a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task the task that was marked done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n");
* Shows a message when a task is marked as not done.
* @param task the task that was unmarked
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n");
* Shows a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task  the task that was deleted
* @param count the new total number of tasks
public void showDelete(Task task, int count) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n\t" + task + "\n");
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays all tasks in the list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");

public void showTasksOn(LocalDate date, List<Task> tasks) {

* The main entry point for the DaBot chatbot application.
* DaBot manages a task list that can contain ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks.
* Users interact with DaBot via text commands (typed into standard input),
* and DaBot responds by updating the task list and saving changes to disk.
* @param filePath the file path to load and save tasks (e.g., "data/dabot.txt")
* Runs the main loop of DaBot.
* Continuously reads user input, parses commands, executes them,
* and provides feedback through the {@link Ui}. This method
* terminates when the user enters the {@code bye} command.
* Application entry point. Creates a {@code DaBot} instance
* and runs it with the default storage location.
* Used to signal errors in parsing commands,
* Creates a new {@code DabotException} with a message.
* Utility class that parses user input strings into actionable commands
* Provides methods to interpret text commands such as creating a {@link Todo},
* {@link Deadline}, or {@link Event}, extracting task indices, and parsing dates.
* Parses a user command string into a specific {@link Task}.
* @param input the full command string entered by the user
* @throws DabotException if the command is unrecognized or required parts are missing
public static Task parseTask(String input) throws DabotException {

throw new DabotException("Event must have a /from and /to clause. Add a proper start and end time!");
throw new DabotException("Event must have a /to clause. Add a proper end time!");
throw new DabotException("Grrrr, I am sorry, I don't know what that means...");

* Represents a deadline task that must be completed by a specific date.
* The date is stored both as the raw string entered by the user

* Constructs a {@code Deadline} with a description and a deadline string.

* it is stored as a {@link LocalDate}. Otherwise, {@code byDate} is set to {@code null}
* and only the raw string is preserved.
* @param description description of the deadline task
* @param by          deadline as entered by the user
this.byDate = LocalDate.parse(by); // if valid, store as date

* otherwise, the raw string entered by the user is shown.

* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* The start and end times are stored both as raw strings
* (to preserve the user’s original input) and as {@link LocalDate}
* objects when the input can be parsed in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* Constructs a new {@code Event} with a description, start time, and end time.
* If the {@code startRaw} or {@code endRaw} strings are valid ISO dates
* ({@code yyyy-MM-dd}), they are also stored as {@link LocalDate} objects.
* Otherwise, the corresponding {@link LocalDate} field is set to {@code null}.
* @param startRaw    start time as entered by the user
* @param endRaw      end time as entered by the user
public Event(String description, String startRaw, String endRaw) {
